benchmark_details.name: Speaker Verification for Audio Large Language Models (ALLMs)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces a benchmark for evaluating the performance of Audio Large Language Models (ALLMs) in speaker verification tasks, showcasing both zero-shot performance and improvements through fine-tuning strategies.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate the capabilities of Audio Large Language Models in speaker verification and to introduce methodologies for evaluation and fine-tuning.

data.source: Public benchmarks including VoxCeleb, CN-Celeb, and 3D-Speaker.
data.size: 9 million training pairs for fine-tuning, 5,560 evaluation pairs for text-dependent SV.
data.annotation: Constructed using hard pair sampling strategy based on speaker attributes.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the model's ability to distinguish between speaker pairs.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy indicates robust performance in distinguishing between speakers based on audio input.
methodology.validation: Fine-tuning performance is compared with zero-shot results to validate improvements.
